title: Number Guessing Game
description: Build a game where the computer picks a number and gives you hints

steps.title: Import random and pick a number
steps.instruction: Import the random module and use random.randint() to pick a number between 1 and 10.
steps.hint: random.randint(1, 10) gives you a random number from 1 to 10 (inclusive).
steps.code:
import random

# Computer picks a random number
secret_number = random.randint(1, 10)
print("I'm thinking of a number between 1 and 10...")

steps.title: Simulate guesses with a while loop
steps.instruction: Create a variable for the guess and a counter for attempts. Use a while loop to simulate multiple guesses.
steps.hint: Since we can't use input() in the browser, simulate guesses by trying different numbers.
steps.code:
# Simulate guessing (in real Python, you'd use input())
guess = 0
attempts = 0
max_attempts = 5

while guess != secret_number and attempts < max_attempts:
    # Simulate a guess (try different numbers)
    guess = 7  # In real game, this would be from input()
    attempts += 1
    
    if guess < secret_number:
        print(f"Too low! Try again. (Attempt {attempts})")
    elif guess > secret_number:
        print(f"Too high! Try again. (Attempt {attempts})")
    else:
        print(f"Correct! You won in {attempts} attempts!")
    
    break  # Remove this in real game

steps.title: Add win/lose conditions
steps.instruction: Check if the player won or ran out of attempts after the loop ends.
steps.hint: Use an if statement after the loop to check if they guessed correctly.

steps.title: Complete game simulation
steps.instruction: Put it all together and simulate a complete game with multiple guesses.
steps.hint: Use a list to simulate multiple guesses instead of input().

solution:
# Number Guessing Game - Complete Solution
import random

# Computer picks a secret number
secret_number = random.randint(1, 10)

# Game simulation (using a list of guesses)
guesses = [3, 7, 5, 8, 5]  # Simulating user input
attempts = 0
max_attempts = 5
won = False

print("=== NUMBER GUESSING GAME ===")
print("I'm thinking of a number between 1 and 10...")
print(f"(Secret: {secret_number}) <- Just for testing!\n")

for guess in guesses:
    attempts += 1
    print(f"Attempt {attempts}/{max_attempts}: You guessed {guess}")
    
    if guess < secret_number:
        print("ðŸ“‰ Too low! Try a higher number.\n")
    elif guess > secret_number:
        print("ðŸ“ˆ Too high! Try a lower number.\n")
    else:
        print(f"\nðŸŽ‰ CORRECT! You won in {attempts} attempts!")
        print(f"The number was {secret_number}!")
        won = True
        break
    
    if attempts >= max_attempts:
        break

if not won:
    print(f"\nðŸ˜ž Game Over! You ran out of attempts.")
    print(f"The secret number was {secret_number}.")

print(f"\nTotal attempts: {attempts}/{max_attempts}")
